commit 591911db1029f2fbb8ba1842bfcc514159b37b32
Merge: eca5f987 79142a02
Author: Mike Schwartz <mfschwartz@google.com>
Date:   2019-02-19 17:48:18 -0700

    Merge pull request #3843 from kevinoid/add-sni
    
    Send SNI for HTTPS connections (required for Google Cloud Storage)

commit 79142a02aa14ba74d66c5a8bf7daf2829892abf9
Author: Kevin Locke <kevin@kevinlocke.name>
Date:   2019-01-15 19:02:15 -0700

    Send SNI for HTTPS connections
    
    Several Google servers, including storage.googleapis.com, send an
    invalid certificate in response to HTTPS connections which do not
    include Server Name Indication (SNI) in ClientHello:
    
        OU = "No SNI provided; please fix your client.", CN = invalid2.invalid
    
    This can be demonstrated by running
    `openssl s_client -connect storage.googleapis.com:443` with and without
    the `-noservername` option.  This causes errors in boto, such as:
    
        Traceback (most recent call last):
          File "./gsbototest.py", line 6, in <module>
            boto.storage_uri('bucket-name', 'gs').create_bucket()
          File "/tmp/boto/boto/storage_uri.py", line 574, in create_bucket
            storage_class)
          File "/tmp/boto/boto/gs/connection.py", line 95, in create_bucket
            data=get_utf8_value(data))
          File "/tmp/boto/boto/s3/connection.py", line 682, in make_request
            retry_handler=retry_handler
          File "/tmp/boto/boto/connection.py", line 1074, in make_request
            retry_handler=retry_handler)
          File "/tmp/boto/boto/connection.py", line 1033, in _mexe
            raise ex
        ssl.SSLError: [SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED] certificate verify failed (_ssl.c:727)
    
    To fix the issue, this commit sends SNI, where possible.  This requires
    calling wrap_socket on an SSLContext instance.  The necessary SSLContext
    is constructed and additional SSLSocket attributes are set using the
    [same code as SSLSocket] to minimize potential differences introduced.
    The code is only called when SSLContext is available (Python 2.7.9 and
    later) and only when OpenSSL is compiled with SNI support.
    
    [same code as SSLSocket]: https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/v2.7.15/Lib/ssl.py#L555-L570
    
    Signed-off-by: Kevin Locke <kevin@kevinlocke.name>

22	4	boto/https_connection.py

commit eca5f987aa59ec7490aa91466853c36b0cf40b3c
Merge: 8fac1878 aa0f1a51
Author: Mike Schwartz <mfschwartz@google.com>
Date:   2018-09-17 09:39:31 -0600

    Merge pull request #3833 from houglum/add_anon_s3_conn_config_option
    
    Allows anon auth'n to S3 via a config option.

commit aa0f1a5137e0062afc34e347d4a9c88e4f94a507
Author: Matt Houglum <houglum@google.com>
Date:   2018-09-16 18:10:07 -0700

    Allows anon auth'n to S3 via a config option.
    
    See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52308440/fetch-content-in-aws-s3-public-bucket-from-gcp-data-storage/52322861#52322861
    for a valid use case for this option.
    
    This option was named after the "--no-sign-request" option in the AWS
    CLI.
    
    The additional changes to provider.py and auth.py are to prevent Boto
    from checking and failing to find credentials on the metadata server
    (and thus spewing error-level logs to the console), and to allow
    pickling to work for the AnonAuthHandler and HmacKeys classes.

16	10	boto/auth.py

8	1	boto/provider.py

commit 8402c5d66f4beeb5ba1cfb6c116d3cc03864f341
Merge: 71d2f08d 8481a437
Author: Mike Schwartz <mfschwartz@google.com>
Date:   2017-09-18 07:26:10 -0700

    Merge pull request #3762 from markhjelm/develop
    
    Fix tests/unit/glacier/test_writer.py to make work with pypy.

commit 8481a437f1512c931eb86a058e6b8f0c04af0a40
Author: Mark Hjelm <markhjelm@google.com>
Date:   2017-09-14 09:42:24 -0700

    Fix to make work with pypy.
    Remove explicit name from expected _Call.
    
    A recent unrelated boto commit exposed a new failure mode in this test when running against pypy (only). The breakage appears to be due to an underlying change in the behavior of pypy, expressed when using assert_has_calls() from mock.py. Investigation revealed that __eq__ in _Call from mock.py is not symmetric (intentionally, related to wildcard tests), and pypy (now?) passes the arguments to __eq__ in the remove method for the built-in list type in a different order than other Python implementations. Including ".layer1.upload_part" in the name of a _Call triggers the problem when mock.py compares it with the unnamed _Call instance it captures internally. Removing the extended name enables the test to perform correctly when run with both pypy and Python 2.7.6 (and presumably others).
    
    See https://bitbucket.org/pypy/pypy/issues/2352/list__contains__-compares-objects-in-wrong and https://bitbucket.org/pypy/pypy/commits/4bd027dc94a24293c504f60f1cea9070a79af0e0 for possibly related pypy changes (although I didn't fully trace the timeline).

1	1	tests/unit/glacier/test_writer.py

commit 71d2f08dd2431ba33b06c6da346e1faf8bd2baf8

commit 9c2fc7e28901c043ce06d9b2c0b3512993a61267
Author: Ed Morley <edmorley@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   2017-05-25 13:25:14 +0100

    Fix generate_url() AttributeError when using anonymous connections
    
    Previously generating a URL would fail for anonymous connections
    (even when using `query_auth=False`), with:
    `AttributeError: 'AnonAuthHandler' object has no attribute '_hmac_256'`
    
    That now works, and in addition the `query_auth=False` parameter
    is now optional for anonymous connections.
    
    Fixes #1540.

5	5	boto/s3/connection.py
12	0	tests/unit/s3/test_connection.py

commit 1effc2601c8e641d23cde9b89453fd42634d417c

    Fix quoting of tilde in S3 canonical_uri for sigv4

1	1	boto/auth.py
2	2	tests/unit/auth/test_sigv4.py

commit 520659aff2d9d0e46605a7bb07740053150d2933
Author: Peter Slawski <petersla@amazon.com>
Date:   2014-12-27 20:17:04 -0800

    Parse unicode query string properly in Python 2
    
    This fixes incorrect signing in sigv4 when using
    non-ascii characters in query string in Python 2
    for S3 requests. The query string parsed for
    sigv4 calculation is done incorrectly in Python 2
    when given a Unicode query with URL-encoded
    non-ascii characters. This is because
    urllib.parse.parse_qs in Python 2 doesn't do
    decoding of URL-encoded %HH bytes.

1	1	boto/auth.py
27	0	boto/utils.py
21	0	tests/unit/auth/test_sigv4.py

commit 6b8cee92728b8a37eac25372cb236d9cde4721c4
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2016-02-19 14:18:36 -0800

    Add better error messages when we can't retrieve creds
    
    When boto retrieves credentials from the instance metadata
    service, there appear to be times when we're just returning an empty
    string back to the user.  When this happens, we need to raise
    a much more clear error message about what's going on.
    
    There's a rare chance that we're actually seeing a 200 OK response
    with text data that isn't the credentials in JSON format.  If that's
    the case we'll need another change that counts that condition as a
    failed attempt.
    
    Fixes #3378.

commit 0fbc774aadbeb5005c6500d526334fe3e20166d2
Author: kyleknap <kyleknap@amazon.com>

1	0	docs/source/_templates/page.html

commit c5047b3dc1800dda7a6a02766c9bafdaa139014e
Author: Garrett Holmstrom <gholms@devzero.com>
Date:   2016-01-29 16:37:13 -0800

    Decode request bodies before passing them to json
    
    AWSAuthConnection._mexe encodes request bodies as UTF-8, mutating the
    original request object in the process.  This breaks kinesis's unit
    tests on at least python 3.4 and 3.5 on Fedora, because those unit tests
    call json.loads, which expect str objects rather than the bytes objects
    that _mexe converted it to.
    
    This commit makes the test cases decode request bodies before feeding
    them to json.loads.

3	3	tests/unit/kinesis/test_kinesis.py

commit 124ca9f50fa5869a056f7c41574500f13917d9af

commit a5877fcd0fbd88890c24dc8466e9fb4655d125b7
Author: Stephen Röttger <sroettger@google.com>
Date:   2016-01-04 15:29:33 +0100

    Remove VeriSign Class 3 CA from trusted certs
    
    Removing the VeriSign Class 3 Public Primary Certification Authority
    certificate since as of December 1, 2015, Symantec has decided that this
    root will no longer comply with the CAB baseline requirements.
    For more information, see:
    https://googleonlinesecurity.blogspot.com/2015/12/proactive-measures-in-digital.html

Merge: f43bbbde d998021d
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>

commit d998021db61ad568e2a7469a22b10837896165b3
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2015-12-21 14:23:12 -0800

    Fix travis CI builds for PY3
    
    Tracking issue here: https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/5246.
    What's happening is that the global boto config on the travis CI
    systems is telling boto to load a plugin that is not compatible with
    python3.
    
    In the meantime, our workaround is to set the BOTO_CONFIG to some bogus
    value so we don't load the global config.

2	0	.travis.yml

commit 53be601f35e7bccd699439b3356bd37f49ab1933
Author: Ryan S. Brown <sb@ryansb.com>
Date:   2015-11-30 13:02:22 -0500

    Fix Glacier test failure in python 3.5 due to MagicMock
    
    In Python 3.5+, the ConcurrentUploader tests were failing due to an
    equality check.
    
    ```
    FAIL: test_correct_low_level_api_calls (tests.unit.glacier.test_concurrent.TestConcurrentUploader)
    ----------------------------------------------------------------------
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/tmp/boto/tests/unit/glacier/test_concurrent.py", line 105, in test_correct_low_level_api_calls
        'vault_name', mock.ANY, mock.ANY, 8 * 1024 * 1024)
      File "/home/ryansb/.pyenv/versions/3.5.0/lib/python3.5/unittest/mock.py", line 792, in assert_called_with
        raise AssertionError(_error_message()) from cause
    AssertionError: Expected call: complete_multipart_upload('vault_name', <ANY>, <ANY>, 8388608)
    Actual call: complete_multipart_upload('vault_name', <MagicMock name='mock.initiate_multipart_upload().__getitem__()' id='140364396570440'>, b'c5aac592460a9ac
    7845e341090f6f9c81f201b63e5338ee8948a6fe6830c55dc', 8388608)
    ```
    
    Note that the MagicMock in the second call position was failing to be equal to mock.ANY.
    
    In a Python 3.5 shell, this can be demonstrated as:
    
    ```
    >>> from unittest import mock
    >>> m = mock.MagicMock()
    >>> mock.ANY == m
    True
    >>> m == mock.ANY
    False
    ```
    
    The tests pass in all supported versions below 3.4, and to get around
    this in 3.5 I added a return value for the `initiate_multipart_upload`
    attribute of the mock that contains a request ID to be checked. This
    prevents `complete_multipart_upload` from being called with the
    MagicMock.

8	2	tests/unit/glacier/test_concurrent.py

Date:   2015-11-25 02:45:31 -0800

commit 7789bd00f7428804a8aa07f99c99b0609590520b
Merge: fc2aa545 29de197e
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2015-08-19 11:06:39 -0700

commit 5f54d8c675da34741431b2e8778f13118d43b6a3
Author: Duncan Regan <duncanregan@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-05 15:25:27 -0400

    updates docs to suggest wrapping time.time() + duration with int()
    
    time.time always returns a float (https://docs.python.org/2/library/time.html#time.time) and this argument expects an int. A float will cause a malformed policy error from cloudfront

Merge: b1cb61ec 9d2d64dc
Author: Daniel G. Taylor <danielgtaylor@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-02-05 16:20:57 -0800

    Merge pull request #2937 from thieman/develop
    
    Correct docs around overriding SGs on ELBs

commit 9d2d64dce1fc275e126520522b47f905535ee74e
Author: Travis Thieman <travis.thieman@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-02-05 16:57:43 -0500

    Correct docs around overriding SGs on ELBs
    
    This commit corrects a critical documentation error where the
    `LoadBalancer.apply_security_groups` and
    `ELBConnection.apply_security_groups_to_lb` methods incorrectly
    state that they add security groups to a load balancer. These
    methods are not additive, rather they override any currently
    applied security groups with the security groups passed to them.
    
    This is potentially catastrophic from a user's perspective as
    a destructive method is being presented as non-destructive.
    
    The AWS documentation for the ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer
    action may be found here:
    http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/APIReference/API_ApplySecurityGroupsToLoadBalancer.html

3	3	boto/ec2/elb/__init__.py
3	3	boto/ec2/elb/loadbalancer.py

commit a3b7ba2bf3fee81878f066dd5b92ad0267ea56dd

    Check for results left after computing self._keys_left

commit 9df2c179e660b185da9b55a8bfebe2231fab26bc
Author: Cosmo Petrich <cosmo.petrich@anchor.net.au>
Date:   2014-12-29 13:11:09 +1100

    Expose cloudformation `UsePreviousTemplate` param
    
    When provided, this parameter causes cloudformation to reuse the current
    template, rather than a new one provided via TemplateBody or
    TemplateURL.
    
    See:
    http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/APIReference/API_UpdateStack.html

commit 32abe3e99961069912b5004e1507d40e785300ae
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2014-12-22 16:45:27 -0800

    Switch elb/ec2 over to signature version 4
    
    This matches the public documentation and other AWS SDKs, which
    all use signature version 4 for these services.
    
    Note that this is no longer a detect_potential_sigv4, we should be
    using signature version 4 at all times for ec2/elb.
    
    I've also updated an assertion method to not require that the
    ignore_params_values actually exist in the request.  We made
    a similar change in the AWS CLI a while back.  All we care about is
    that we're not validating those params.  We don't actually care
    if they're in the serialized params are not.

1	2	boto/ec2/connection.py
1	1	boto/ec2/elb/__init__.py
4	5	tests/unit/__init__.py

commit 5506aba84638f921bc84b125f78d5e1c600d14fb
Author: Patrick Kelley <pkelley@netflix.com>
Date:   2014-12-15 14:19:45 -0800

    FIXING SES get_identity_dkim_attributes fails when input length > 1
    
    boto.ses.connection::get_identity_dkim_attributes would call
    _make_request() but would incorrectly parse the XML response from AWS.
    If an input list with length greater than 1 was provided, this method
    would only return a response for a single list element.
    
    Adding DkimAttributes to list_markers and updating unit tests.

2	2	boto/ses/connection.py
24	3	tests/unit/ses/test_identity.py

commit 21e9191ba915a55fe653515dd84c01f003172a6f
Author: Garth Berry <garth@serviceagility.co.uk>
Date:   2014-12-15 01:14:26 +0000

    Added test to cover empty batch result in a batch_get operation. All keys should be processed rather than returning on first empty batch result.

6	0	tests/integration/dynamodb2/test_highlevel.py

commit f57f2b709cea6b3a51f8aeb42579644478bb9227
Author: Garth Berry <garth@serviceagility.co.uk>
Date:   2014-12-15 01:12:51 +0000

    Due to batching an empty result does not imply there are no results left. Consider a table containing 100k items, a batch get is executed for 10k items. Of those 10k items about 50% do not exist. If a single batch request of 100 items (the DynamoDB limit) does not contain a result then no further results will be processed.

0	1	boto/dynamodb2/results.py

commit daefa712096ea30686315764deba697c4cace9f8
Author: Daniel Cross <daniel.cross@rea-group.com>
Date:   2014-12-01 15:17:14 +1100

    Add support for private hosted zones
    
    Utilising the existing create_zone and create_hosted_zone functions,
    create a private zone by using the new arguments:
    
    private_zone=True, VPCId='<vpcid>', VPCRegion='<region>'
    
    Tested locally to not break current functionality
    
    AWS API documentation on private hosted zones:
    http://docs.aws.amazon.com/Route53/latest/APIReference/actions-on-zones-private.html

31	8	boto/route53/connection.py

    Detect old-style S3 URL for auto-sigv4.
    
    This fixes detection of signature version 4 for the eu-central-1 region
    when creating connections using the old-style URL, which is listed on
    the [supported regions and endpoints](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#s3_region):
    
    ```
    s3-eu-central-1.amazonaws.com
    ```

commit 8b089b253a99d6c5d52894ede9b032a01cd7eea8
Author: Luca Bruno <luca.bruno@rocket-internet.de>
Date:   2014-08-28 16:37:03 +0200

    iam: add support for Account Password Policy APIs
    
    This commits adds support to iam module for all currently available APIs
    related to Account Password Policy, introducing three new public methods:
     * get_account_password_policy()
     * delete_account_password_policy()
     * update_account_password_policy()
    
    IAM Password Policy and API reference:
    http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/Using_ManagingPasswordPolicies.html
    
    Signed-off-by: Luca Bruno <luca.bruno@rocket-internet.de>

commit 3f5e16dd04bd31b5f2f6441288e47bf7c3a82adf
Author: Paul Graydon <paulgraydon@hotmail.com>
Date:   2014-10-31 13:57:31 -0700

    Improve handling of HTTP 204 responses.
    
    HTTP 204 responses have no body, but can have any headers they like,
    including, counter-intuitively, ones specifying the content type.
    
    This makes sure Boto won't pass a 0 length body to the json parser in
    response to a 204 status from Glacier.
    
    Unit test added to catch any regression.

4	3	boto/glacier/response.py
35	0	tests/unit/glacier/test_response.py

commit 445f6bf3dc1b61477407c375133d8e975564566c
Author: kyleknap <kyleknap@amazon.com>
Date:   2014-09-18 13:35:30 -0700

    Inserted break when iterating Route53 records.
    
    ``find_records()`` would iterate through the entire zone even though there
    were no more matching records since records are returned sorted. Added
    break statement so iteration stops after there is no more matching
    records to return.

commit 7980e0bad3364ef3e183d28cc691e4c0658bda83
Author: Ted Timmons <ted@perljam.net>
Date:   2014-09-16 13:43:35 -0700

    fix ELB ConnectionSettings values in documentation
    
    While elb.attributes.ConnectionSettingAttribute is the name of the class, the get_ and modify_ classes sniff for "connectingsettings" (note 'ing' and plural 's' at end). The safest thing to do is to make the documentation correct. Another possibility would be to add an 'or' to the conditionals.

2	2	boto/ec2/elb/__init__.py

commit 2a8c5729e917d4161ea90cab950408131b851b36
Author: Vincent Wong <duperduper@ucla.edu>
Date:   2014-09-13 13:35:49 -0700

    Added tests for TaggedEC2Object.remove_tags
    
    There are 3 tests: test_remove_tags simply makes sure multiple tags are deleted
    in one request. test_remove_tags_wrong_values makes sure tags that are provided
    wrong values are not deleted. test_remove_tags_none_values make sure that tags
    provided with None values are unconditionally deleted.

65	0	tests/unit/ec2/test_ec2object.py

commit c269cbe996d28fef383ab7a5dbb0b1ae6b0015af
Author: Vincent Wong <duperduper@ucla.edu>
Date:   2014-09-13 13:24:00 -0700

    Fixed remove_tags not checking values, fixed test
    
    Fixed Issue #2414. remove_tags now locally verifies that the value given for a
    key matches the one in self.tags before deleting it.
    
    Fixed TestRemoveTags.test_remove_tag_empty_value in ec2/test_ec2object. An
    empty string is _not_ supposed to act like None to unconditionally delete the
    tag. The original test acted like it does.

2	1	boto/ec2/ec2object.py
2	1	tests/unit/ec2/test_ec2object.py

commit 74b37400324ad31039f38618d05b9fdaf05815d4
Author: Vincent Wong <duperduper@ucla.edu>
Date:   2014-09-13 12:23:08 -0700

    Removed duplicate code in add_tag and remove_tag
    
    Since add_tags is a more general version of add_tag that uses the same API
    call, add_tag can simply call add_tags with the correct parameters. Likewise
    for remove_tag and remove_tags.
    
    For remove_tag in particular, these lines were redundant:
    
        if value is not None:
            tags = {key : value}
        else:
            tags = [key]
    
    Since EC2Connection.delete_tags just converts the list back to a dict of {key:
    None} anyway, these extra checks serve no purpose.

2	19	boto/ec2/ec2object.py

commit ab464f99456d12a9dcc18a216849a89ffd7ede5e
Author: Vincent Wong <duperduper@ucla.edu>
Date:   2014-09-13 12:14:26 -0700

    Added method TaggedEC2Object.remove_tags()
    
    Pull Request #2259 already created an add_tags method to supplement the add_tag
    call. Not sure why there isn't an analogous remove_tags method, since the
    DeleteTags API also supports removng multiple tags at once. An immediate use
    case is to be able to delete all the tags of an instance; with only remove_tag,
    this will unnecessarily involve many round trips to AWS.

30	7	boto/ec2/ec2object.py

commit 2e771c17678e33ecabaff6b78c7bf53e41a95ce7
Author: Joe Crobak <joe@projectfla.com>
Date:   2014-09-02 17:26:21 +0000

    Support EBS encryption in BlockDeviceType.
    
    Support an optional configuration of ebs encryption in the
    BlockDeviceType (which is used to build a BlockDeviceMapping).
    
    The encrypted flag is optional (defaulting to `None`), as the AWS
    API doesn't support any value for this flag for the root device
    of a new instance.

commit a977445fea0feb745166e7c4238cb1853db642f9
Author: Garrett Holmstrom <gholms@devzero.com>
Date:   2014-08-22 14:39:02 -0700

    Include test_endpoints.json in source distribution
    
    MANIFEST.in recursively includes .py and .txt files for tests in source
    distributions, but not .json files, causing unit tests to fail when run
    outside of a git checkout.  This commit fixes that issue.
    
    Downstream bug:  https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1072925

1	1	MANIFEST.in

commit c085bd681c68ec42c3d351b165fe8ffcbcd1d9c5
Author: cshanes <cshanes@umich.edu>
Date:   2014-08-22 14:51:11 -0400

    Assigning ACL ID to network_acl_id  instead of route_table_id
    
    In the endElement method, in NetworkAclAssociation, the networkAclId is getting assigned to the variable self.route_table_id instead of self.network_acl_id. NetworkAclAssociations should not have a route_table_id variable.

1	1	boto/vpc/networkacl.py

commit d358ee4254f48031d7109dbba09df363e212523f
Author: Daniel G. Taylor <danielgtaylor@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-08-14 13:38:50 -0700

    Better S3 key repr support for unicode
    
    This ensures that S3 `Key` objects always return a `str` type from the
    `__repr__` method. On Python 3 this is essentially a no-op, but on Python
    2 this means encoding the unicode characters before display. It fixes
    the exception raised in #2516.

8	2	boto/s3/key.py
6	0	tests/unit/s3/test_key.py

commit b161f611081e9dc4369d53cc12957137fe6a9579
Author: Daniel G. Taylor <danielgtaylor@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-08-13 15:37:23 -0700

    Support auth when headers contains bytes
    
    This fixes #2520 by checking whether headers are `bytes` and decoding
    them before performing string operations. It adds a new test covering
    this functionality which now passes on all supported Python versions.

2	0	boto/auth.py

Author: Daniel G. Taylor <danielgtaylor@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-08-04 10:51:33 -0700

    Several fixes for Python 3 behavior.
    
    Attempts to throw a useful error if a file is passed in but not opened
    in binary mode on Python 3. If a file-like object without a `mode` param
    is passed in instead, then we make every attempt to decode to bytes,
    falling back to UTF-8 if no encoding is specified.

7	1	boto/glacier/utils.py
13	0	tests/unit/glacier/test_utils.py
3	1	tests/unit/glacier/test_vault.py

commit 88b3ef20689a9ceefc06789e1a2e729aeb4aef5d
Author: Alex Konradi <alex.konradi@purestorage.com>
Date:   2014-08-01 18:07:01 -0700

    Fix dynamodb.types.Binary non-ASCII handling
    
    Python 2.6/7 strings are used for both text and non-ASCII byte strings. Since
    the boto.dynamodb.types.Binary type is used for representing binary (and likely
    non-ASCII) data, encoding and decoding the internal string representation as
    UTF-8 doesn't make sense. This commit fixes the Python 2 version of Binary.

4	4	boto/dynamodb/types.py
9	0	tests/unit/dynamodb/test_types.py

commit 59ad5e21953a6d591f82def11aebd64808ab9559
Author: Olli Pottonen <olli.pottonen@iki.fi>
Date:   2014-08-03 12:01:29 +1000

    Improve metadata processing (system vs. user-defined).
    
    Let Key.base_fields (boto/s3/key.py) be a list of all system metadata. All
    metadata processing shall refer to that list and treat everything included
    as system metadata and everything else as user metadata (which gets
    x-amz-meta- prefix.)

commit 7f88166535c746c033c988f5e09dd54c8bdb565c
Author: Felix Yan <felixonmars@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-07-30 18:42:25 +0800

    remove obsolete md5 import routine
    
    The old md5 module was deprecated since Python 2.5, and we even didn't
    support that version already. The current implementation in
    boto/utils.py will not even work under Python 2.4 because of the name
    "md5" imported from md5 module was replaced by the md5 module in the
    following routine, which will cause errors.

1	5	boto/s3/key.py

1	5	tests/integration/s3/mock_storage_service.py

commit 249fd95d1f837cb9a694fac03c4325c27b8301a4
Author: Daniel G. Taylor <danielgtaylor@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-07-28 13:41:19 -0700

    Fix parsing of EMR step summary response.
    
    EMR step summaries can now contain a `<Config>` section that includes a list
    of arguments. The argument list contains items wrapped in `<member>` and this
    gets picked up by the step list parser to incorrectly create blank EMR step
    objects. The fix is to parse the config and arguments so that they don't
    bubble up to incorrectly become new step objects.

4	0	boto/emr/emrobject.py
80	1	tests/unit/emr/test_connection.py

commit 0ef0466ff51b6b24971c23237d59f1dc1a7a24f5

commit fc8d8467b74aad91c68cc86c803176d1a8890d62
Author: Zoltan Kozma <kozmaz87@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-07-15 14:16:34 +0100

    Fixing bug in cloudsearch2 commit implementation. The response object along with the errors list goes missing and the user of the boto library cannot determine the cause of the commit failure and can't address certain cases automatically by parsing the errors list. This is an attempt to fix this. There are better ways but this is one that has the least impact on the codebase and tests.

commit 96cd2800b6db067e503ef499486adf50ee9ca928
Author: Daniel G. Taylor <danielgtaylor@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-06-20 14:47:20 -0700

    Initial work to support Python 3.3+
    
    This updates most of the code to be forward-compatible with Python 3.3 and
    3.4 while still continuing to support 2.6 and 2.7. It **drops** support for
    Python 2.5.
    
    Python 3 support is added for common Boto modules (`boto/*.py`) as well as
    S3, SQS, Kinesis and CloudTrail. Several other modules may work but have
    not been thoroughly tested.
    
    The `tox` configuration has been updated to run tests for all supported
    environments, and for now a whitelist is used for Python 3 unit tests.
    
    A new porting guide is included to help community members port other
    modules to Python 3, and both the README and Sphinx index list which
    modules currently support Python 3.

commit dec2ff95e49abb6b0c043098da30dddf69163b25
Author: Tryggvi Bjorgvinsson <tryggvi.bjorgvinsson@okfn.org>
Date:   2014-06-25 09:09:18 +0000

    Add a test case for ACL policy namespace

32	0	tests/unit/s3/test_bucket.py

commit c39fa51df3aac92110a279ff66ef081bea747506
Author: Tryggvi Bjorgvinsson <tryggvi.bjorgvinsson@okfn.org>
Date:   2014-06-24 13:42:15 +0000

    Add namespace to AccessControlPolicy xml representation
    
    Scality implements S3 which is for instance used by GreenQloud to
    provide an S3 interface to their Storage Qloud. Scality's
    implementation requires the AccessControlPolicy to include a
    namespace attribute to work properly. This xmls namespace is
    retrieved from the parsed AccessControlPolicy.
    
    This is also what the example in the Amazon S3 docs does:
    http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/RESTBucketPUTacl.html
    
    This commit adds the namespace attribute to the xml representation
    of the Policy object so that it can be used to set acl grants thus
    providing support for Scality storage clouds, like the GreenQloud
    one, in boto.
    
    Thanks to Tryggvi Lárusson, CTO of GreenQloud, for identifying this.

8	1	boto/s3/acl.py

commit 4e2888f50b8ab5e49253c52e03b41c6cb6af2551

commit cf15e7f71ba70ed54f96029b71d2bc19c656c5b6
Author: Rohit Agarwal <rohita@qubole.com>
Date:   2014-05-09 15:59:53 +0530

    Add method TaggedEC2Object.add_tags().
    
    There is already a TaggedEC2Object.add_tag() method but it only supports
    adding one tag at a time. The CreateTags api supports adding multiple tags
    at once. So, when you want to add multiple tags you needlessly make multiple
    round-trips to EC2 service. The add_tags method helps in avoiding that.

21	0	boto/ec2/ec2object.py

    Changes the following:
    * Generated layer1.py from service model
    * Layer1 -> CloudSearchConnection
    * Layer1 now uses JSON instead of XML responses
    * Updated layer2 objects to use JSON and generated layer1
    * Updated doc service to remove attributes which are no longer valid
    * Updated search service to remove attributes which are no longer valid and
      modify existing attributes which have changed
    * Updated unit tests and integration tests for all of the above

commit ff7700dfcee84ae04831df82578eb16119e7aa92
Author: Brandon Adams <brandon.adams@me.com>
Date:   2014-03-28 16:09:09 -0700

    Align volume delete on terminate with AWS defaults
    
    Updated the BlockDeviceType to have a default to terminate volumes on
    instance termination, the same as the AWS default as documented in these
    pages:
      http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/block-device-mapping-concepts.html
      http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-RegisterImage.html
    
    Also updated register_image to allow for users to explicitly set their
    delete on terminate preference when creating an image from a snapshot.
    
    Updated tests to work with the new default, and created new tests to
    assert that the default behavior is in place.

1	1	boto/ec2/blockdevicemapping.py

2	2	tests/unit/ec2/autoscale/test_group.py
2	2	tests/unit/ec2/test_blockdevicemapping.py

commit 1045a83e010888d3e121bc272cecf09e3a9584ba
Author: Stuart Warren <stuart.warren@ocado.com>
Date:   2014-03-18 17:23:47 +0000

    Fix specification of elasticbeanstalk tier
    
    According to the API: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/elasticbeanstalk/latest/api/API_CreateEnvironment.html
    The ``member`` part of the Tier key names is not valid.
    I was always getting:
    {"Error":{"Code":"InvalidParameterValue","Message":"Environment tier definition not found","Type":"Sender"},"RequestId":"xxxxx"}
    
    This allows an environment to be created and to specify the tier_name and tier_type.

commit 0cd457906bc53d2f55d8a4b028bf8505b2fbbb17
Author: Daniel Beardsley <daniel@ifixit.com>
Date:   2014-03-04 17:49:54 -0700

    S3 Metadata: allow storage of plus signs (+)
    
    Previously, there was no way to reliably store and then retrieve
    meta-data values that contained plus signs. quote_plus left existing
    pluses as they were while encoding spaces as "+". This would turn a
    value like "x+ +x" into "x+++x" which upon retrieval from S3 using boto
    would be decoded into "x   x".
    
    This change allows storage of plus characters "+" in s3 key metadata
    values.

1	1	boto/connection.py
1	1	boto/utils.py
2	2	tests/integration/s3/test_key.py

commit c31948ba3f026b0a3a2f75238564b6812540c1b7
Author: Daniel Beardsley <daniel@ifixit.com>
Date:   2014-03-04 17:44:57 -0700

    S3 Metadata: add failing test case for plus signs
    
    Without adding your own encoding layer ontop of boto's, there is no way
    to reliably store and then retrieve meta-data values that contain plus
    signs. quote_plus leaves existing pluses as they are while encoding
    spaces as "+". This turns a value like "x+ +x" into "x+++x" which upon
    retrieval from S3 using boto is decoded into "x   x".
    
    A further commit will fix the bug.

2	0	tests/integration/s3/test_key.py

commit 24675478bf2b169a1f4cf33f703c8528c46ce636

Author: Daniel Lindsley <daniel@toastdriven.com>

commit cf8b2f0f29c979b91d2606aa40b4bacceb11e8ad
Author: Robert Schweikert <rjschwei@suse.com>
Date:   2014-03-03 11:54:12 -0500

    - Allow the use of system provided certificate setup that may be incorporated
      into the SSL library used on the specific system
      + At present we either use the default certificate bundle we ship with the
        boto source, or we force a user/integrator to create a bundle file of their
        own. Linux distributors build the way certificates are used and validated
        into their SSL implementation. This change allows integrators to use their
        way of certificate handling by setting the configuration to the new
        "system" keyword.

10	4	boto/connection.py
6	2	boto/https_connection.py
4	1	docs/source/boto_config_tut.rst

commit cc0f694babc30ef868ca9320c25c391a29bb4de5
Author: Daniel G. Taylor <danielgtaylor@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-02-20 16:00:44 -0800

    Handle JSON error responses in BotoServerError.
    
    Attempts to fix services which may return JSON error responses. For example,
    CloudFormation might return something like:
    
    ```json
    {
      "Error": {
        "Code": "ValidationError",
        "Message": "Template error: Unable to get mapping for RegionMap::us-west-2::AMI",
        "Type": "Sender"
      },
      "RequestId": "xxxxxx-xxxxx-xxxxx"
    }
    ```
    
    The error, when represented as a string looks like:
    
    ```python
    boto.exception.BotoServerError: BotoServerError: 400 Bad Request
    None
    ```
    
    After this fix, the `None` is replaced with the response body, and the
    `BotoServerError.[request_id|error_code|message]` values are filled in.

1	1	boto/cloudformation/connection.py
24	6	boto/exception.py
3	2	tests/unit/cloudformation/test_connection.py

commit 65a4323ba3d4e66a9b62c8293dd667ea9719d062

commit b060e70532a954b751e80c004719e1cb267ae0fa
Author: Thomas O'Dowd <tpodowd@cloudian.com>
Date:   2014-01-22 18:26:58 +0900

    Make the Lifecycle Id optional and fix prefix=None in XML generation.
    
    The id is optional in the AWS PUT Lifecycle API. Boto currently
    always sets the Id to 'None' if you set the rule directly.
    Fix the XML generation to not send the Id if id is None.
    
    If prefix is not set on a Rule, Boto generates a prefix for the
    string 'None' which is not a good default value. Instead
    generate the empty string for the prefix if not given so that
    it matches all Objects in the bucket.
    
    Modified the add_rule() API to allow the id to be optional which
    also forced making other parameters optional by specifying
    defaults. This makes adding simple rules easier though and is
    backwards compatible.
    
    Added 2 test cases to test the changes.

14	9	boto/s3/lifecycle.py
20	1	tests/integration/s3/test_bucket.py

commit d332dab30b61e75e6f048ff30f7add5912135684
Author: Cyril Roelandt <cyril.roelandt@enovance.com>
Date:   2014-01-22 17:37:34 +0100

    test_refresh_credentials(): use UTC instead of local time.
    
    In test_refresh_credentials(), datetime.now() is used to set the
    _credential_expiry_time field of a provider. This value is later compared to
    the result of datetime.utcnow() in _credentials_need_refresh(). This comparison
    is meaningless. Use datetime.utcnow() in test_refresh_credentials() to fix
    this.

1	1	tests/unit/provider/test_provider.py

commit c6d39d730517d7a514588165864910dc18d99834
Author: Thomas O'Dowd <tpodowd@cloudian.com>
Date:   2014-01-14 13:45:30 +0900

    Return the x-amz-restore header with GET KEY and fix provider prefix.
    
    Currently x-amz-restore is only supported by HEAD KEY but GET KEY also
    returns the header when it has been successfully restored and the
    restored key is awaiting expiry. Fixed the provider 'x-amz-' prefix
    part so that it's consistent with other standard headers. Previously,
    it was hardcoded.
    
    This patch is hard to automate a test for as transitioning to GLACIER
    and restoring back from GLACIER both take time. This change has been
    manually tested.

4	0	boto/provider.py
3	1	boto/s3/key.py

Author: Daniel Lindsley <daniel@toastdriven.com>

commit 6928928775dac1607e03197c437d8503574466cb
Author: Daniel G. Taylor <danielgtaylor@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-01-06 14:09:39 -0800

    Populate both next_token and nextToken. Fixes #1968.
    
    This bug was introduced due to an issue with how boto handled the nextToken
    field in responses, which meant that it was exposed with the incorrect
    name. The fix caused existing code to break, so now both versions are made
    available. New code should use next_token.

commit b7a8b1900c3d7fe00085dacd4203f185d8b09bf4
Author: kdmukai <keith.mukai@essaytagger.com>
Date:   2013-12-22 13:05:41 -0600

    Remove unnecessary '?' from req.path on POST
    
    The if/else logic in add_auth on line 491 only handles if qs and POST.
    
    But if you're POSTing with no query string, execution falls into the else condition on line 497 and an unnecessary '?' is added with a blank query string.
    
    My elastictranscoder.create_job calls were failing due to the unnecessary '?' in the path. It would return:
    
    JSONResponseError: 403 Forbidden
    {u'message': u"When Content-Type:application/x-www-form-urlencoded, URL cannot include query-string parameters (after '?'): '/2012-09-25/jobs?'"}
    
    I'm not sure why, but the bug only happens when running on Google App Engine. My local dev_appserver was able to make the create_job request just fine.

4	1	boto/auth.py

commit 20cb1ac2dcbb6693525ef22c997fa57202d9cb30
Author: Will Maier <wcmaier@m.aier.us>
Date:   2013-10-17 05:02:37 +0000

    Re-raise the last exception in the current scope.
    
    `raise` with no arguments finds the last exception in the active scope; this
    is the correct way to re-raise an exception that is caught but not handled.
    Raising the caught exception object obscures stack information (like line
    number) that may be useful for debugging.

2	2	boto/connection.py

commit 7e101f6b1c11eaefc809fb7d96412d365e4ba087

Date:   2013-09-20 13:30:50 +0100

commit cdef0b452de0f8431d04f648ef2e2caa14dc4042
Author: Paul Melnikow <paul.melnikow@bodylabs.com>
Date:   2013-10-31 17:34:40 -0400

    sqs.message: Raising an exception in decode() should not abort parsing
    
    Since AWS seems to return Body before ReceiptHandle, raising an exception in decode() will abort processing before the receipt handle is read.
    
    This is a problem, because there's no way to dequeue the message without the handle.
    
    Instead, wait to invoke decode() until parsing is finished.

2	0	boto/handler.py
4	1	boto/sqs/message.py
31	0	tests/unit/sqs/test_message.py

4	3	docs/source/swf_tut.rst

commit 50e3bc6148760515945f24c7417c400f21ceca04
Author: Will Maier <wcmaier@m.aier.us>
Date:   2013-10-17 05:02:37 +0000

    Re-raise the last exception in the current scope.
    
    `raise` with no arguments finds the last exception in the active scope; this
    is the correct way to re-raise an exception that is caught but not handled.
    Raising the caught exception object obscures stack information (like line
    number) that may be useful for debugging.

2	2	boto/connection.py

Merge: 977b7dc8 89c6fa90

    Merge pull request #1773 from danielgtaylor/con-close

commit 89c6fa90d714854afd79cdc1fbec91fd03381b5c
Author: Daniel G. Taylor <danielgtaylor@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-10-07 15:55:19 -0700

    Do not put connections that have been closed via the connection: close header back into the connection pool. This prevents an issue where a successful response with a connection: close header can cause dead connection reuse which leads to timeouts and errors.

11	2	boto/connection.py
27	0	tests/unit/test_connection.py

Author: Daniel Harris <dih0658@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-09-04 14:06:16 -0400

    Add "billingProducts" support on Images
    
    Parsing of any AMI (windows, etc) with extra billing caused parsing errors resulting in missing data from the resulting image object. Instead parse the billingProducts attribute as a list of product codes.

commit eee7d14403fa74a1dcf53c005bfd8aea5cc2517c
Author: Thomas Orozco <thomas@orozco.fr>
Date:   2013-09-02 16:54:52 +0200

    s3put: accept headers values containing "="
    
    s3put tries to split headers on the "=" sign. Some headers include a "=" sign (e.g. max-age), and can't be used.
    
    This pull request splits on the first equal sign to support those.
    
    Caveat: if a user uses the command correctly (`s3put --header "header1=value1 header2=value2"), they won't get an exception.

1	1	bin/s3put

commit fc654cf6f5c32b69394b7c9dbbfc25849aaa921d

commit ffc6cc0d0b464c8297323895a18eb7ef22d97bb7
Author: Garrett Holmstrom <gholms@fedoraproject.org>
Date:   2013-06-21 18:14:35 -0700

    Start moving get_all_instances to get_all_reservations
    
    get_all_instances doesn't actually get all instances, but rather gets
    all *reservations*, which themselves contain instances.  This commit
    starts the process of making get_all_instances actually return a list of
    instances by doing a few things:
    
    1. Rename the current get_all_instances to get_all_reservations.
    2. Make get_all_instances a stub that warns and then calls
       get_all_reservations.
    3. Add a new get_only_instances method that will eventually become the
       new behavior of get_all_instances.
    
    People can then transition to get_all_reservations and
    get_only_instances as appropriate until get_all_instances finally
    switches over in a future release.

2	3	bin/elbadmin
1	1	bin/instance_events
1	1	bin/list_instances
57	0	boto/ec2/connection.py
1	1	boto/ec2/instance.py
6	2	boto/ec2/securitygroup.py

Author: Thomas O'Dowd <tpodowd@cloudian.com>
Date:   2013-08-20 16:13:20 +0900

    Return the part/key so that the user can manage multipart uploads
    
    Currently uploading a part does not return the key. The key is
    important as it contains the server generated etag which may
    then be used by the user to complete the multipart upload
    without asking the server for a list of parts.

commit 70f363abfa01f082137340f65b47dc69451ab182
Author: Nate <nate@knewton.com>
Date:   2013-08-13 12:03:13 -0400

    Bugfix: s/LastUpdatedTimestamp/LastUpdatedTime
    
    The cloudformation api is returning xml that does not have
    LastUpdatedTimestamp elements, but rather LastUpdatedTime elements. Here
    is an example:
    
    <ListStacksResponse xmlns="http://cloudformation.amazonaws.com/doc/2010-05-15/">
      <ListStacksResult>
        <StackSummaries>
    
    ...snip
    
          <member>
          <StackId>STACKY_DOO_DAH</StackId>
          <StackStatus>UPDATE_COMPLETE</StackStatus>
    ==>   <LastUpdatedTime>2013-08-09T18:58:22Z</LastUpdatedTime>
          <StackName>StackyDooDah</StackName>
          <CreationTime>2013-08-09T15:18:49Z</CreationTime>
          <TemplateDescription>juggernauts</TemplateDescription>
          <StackStatusReason/>
          </member>
    
    This commit fixes this and adjusts a couple of tests accordingly.

4	4	boto/cloudformation/stack.py
4	4	tests/unit/cloudformation/test_connection.py
4	4	tests/unit/cloudformation/test_stack.py

commit 243a67e728db7a46ebde29aff49e4696afd751e2
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2013-08-01 12:38:39 -0700

    Fix slow tests to not actually sleep
    
    These two tests were causing the unit tests to
    take 2min40secs to run.  The fix is to patch time.sleep
    because we don't actually actually need to sleep during
    the tests.
    
    I also updated the tests to be more idiomatic including:
    
    * Don't need to define setUp() if you're just calling super()
    * Prefer assertRaises(), this gives better failure messages
      and is easier to read.

Date:   2013-07-31 12:08:10 -0400

    added non-zero exit statuses for unsuccessful runs
    
    Previously, the program always exited 0 unless it crashed.  This covered many of the failure scenarios like "permission denied" and "The specified bucket does not exist", but didn't cover anything that would provoke usage() to be called ("-h" notwithstanding)
    
    This adds an arbitrarily ascending list of non-zero exit codes to all the cases of "usage" and also the exit() called for unaviliable multi-part upload.  usage() not defaults to exit status 1, since -h has been covered and most other uses of usage() would be for error conditions

7	7	bin/s3put

commit 08650048581dc75f2477179ce20f273efeead958
Author: Jerm <github@jerm.org>
Date:   2013-07-31 11:51:11 -0400

    -w flag never actually checked s3 for a file's existence. Always refused to upload.

4	3	bin/s3put

commit d206d290f32227da04f9fc13e40028aab1dd60a2
Author: Jeff Terrace <jterrace@google.com>

    Add support for no_proxy to HTTP connections
    
    In addition to the http_proxy environment variable, most url
    handlers support a no_proxy environment variable, containing a
    comma-delimited list of domains to ignore.

commit c5dffcfc3afcf4f346d139462d4b67f254f1152d
Author: John Le <moonpiesandbox@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-05-30 02:12:29 -0600

    Update connection.py: get_path when suppress_consec_slashes is False
    
    Should fix boto/boto#1387
    
    When suppressing consec slashes is set to False, slashes at the beginning of the key are suppressed too aggressively.  It shouldn't turn all slashes at the beginning to empty. It should decrease the number of prefix slashes by 1.
    
    This likely depends on self.path being ending in a "/".

commit 215ffa26e5718b88c22435e3a75d52c2fab46a78
Author: g2harris <greg.2.harris@nokia.com>
Date:   2013-05-31 11:18:50 -0300

    Fix AttributeErrors thrown when LoadBalancerZones is used by adding endElement stub
    
    LoadBalancerZones right now isn't actually a valid xml.sax Handler.  We just need to add an endElement stub so that the sax parser has something to call while parsing the object, otherwise it throws the below AttributeError:
    
    """
      File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/boto/ec2/elb/loadbalancer.py", line 173, in disable_zones
        new_zones = self.connection.disable_availability_zones(self.name, zones)
      File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/boto/ec2/elb/__init__.py", line 322, in disable_availability_zones
        params, LoadBalancerZones)
      File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/boto/connection.py", line 1114, in get_object
        xml.sax.parseString(body, h)
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/xml/sax/__init__.py", line 49, in parseString
        parser.parse(inpsrc)
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/xml/sax/expatreader.py", line 107, in parse
        xmlreader.IncrementalParser.parse(self, source)
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/xml/sax/xmlreader.py", line 123, in parse
        self.feed(buffer)
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/xml/sax/expatreader.py", line 207, in feed
        self._parser.Parse(data, isFinal)
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/xml/sax/expatreader.py", line 304, in end_element
        self._cont_handler.endElement(name)
      File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/boto/handler.py", line 39, in endElement
        self.nodes[-1][1].endElement(name, self.current_text, self.connection)
    AttributeError: 'LoadBalancerZones' object has no attribute 'endElement'
    """
    
    Maybe all these classes should inherit from a base class which has a stub for startElement and endElement to make sure there is a safe fallback for the future?

2	0	boto/ec2/elb/loadbalancer.py

commit 9e041710d63632aaa29dc041d503dbe5c69084ca
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2013-05-20 11:06:17 -0700

    Adjust part size as needed in create_archive_from_file
    
    Fixes #1478, original patch suggested by @dminkovsky.
    If we have a large enough file such that the default part size
    is not sufficient to stay within the maximum number of parts
    allowed by glacier, we automatically adjust the part size
    to the minimum required.  We were previously calculating this
    value but not actually doing anything with it.

1	2	boto/glacier/vault.py
14	0	tests/unit/glacier/test_vault.py

commit 550e003840bef2b1be387b794d72e3f8da2e9f11
Author: Kyle Conroy <kyle@twilio.com>
Date:   2013-05-08 12:47:17 -0700

    Fix variable overwrite in build_put_params
    
    Before this patch, the for loop at the bottom of `build_put_params`
    would overwrite the passed in value variable, resulting in spurious
    log messages:
    
        'You supplied a value and statistics for a metric. Posting
         statistics and not value.'
    
    I've changed the variable name from value to val to prevent the
    overwrite and stop the spurious log messages.

2	2	boto/ec2/cloudwatch/__init__.py

commit 924a8d108accd4c95382aeddeea4a6839c54ec88

commit a9e834ae4b85d787092e5b0d86b2ce8566d9a7a0
Merge: 89f49470 38f8bec0
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2013-04-30 18:15:59 -0700

    Merge branch 'release-2.9.1'
    
    * release-2.9.1:
      Bumping version to 2.9.1
      Support docs & release notes.
      Initial Support API addition.
      Change num_retries default for resumable download handler to be 6, to be consistent w/ num_retries elsewhere in the code
      Added a ``connect_redshift`` function for easier access to a ``RedShiftConnection``.
      Fixed the error type checking.
      Updated DynamoDB v2 to incorporate retries & checksums.
      Allow port override in boto config
      Fix typo bug in autoscale tutorial.
      Trying to make the docs around the count param a bit more clear.
      Add clarifying comment about using OrdinaryCallingFormat in storage_uri.

commit d84606e17f495c1b4840497199acdddd15af5515
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2013-04-12 16:23:41 -0700

    Only use 2 metadata service calls to get credentials
    
    Because of the lazy loading dict returned when retrieving
    IAM role credentials, we were making twice as many calls:
    
    * .../meta-data/
    * .../meta-data/iam/
    * .../meta-data/iam/security-credentials/
    * .../meta-data/iam/security-credentials/role-name
    
    Instead the ``data`` arg is used so that we can make only two
    calls, one to retrieve the role name, and one to retrieve the
    actual credentials:
    
    * .../meta-data/iam/security-credentials/
    * .../meta-data/iam/security-credentials/role-name

6	4	boto/provider.py
16	33	tests/unit/provider/test_provider.py

commit 1d9d2939f511586c1e0f9ccd9f32be4bb5b96bf7
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2013-04-12 16:09:58 -0700

    Fix #1146: return response from custom url opener
    
    The previous fix for this (70e9ec) created a proxy opener
    and retrieved metadata results, but then called urlopen(...)
    and returned those results.  The end result was that you
    were getting the proxied result, which is not what we want.
    
    As a side effect of this bug, we were making twice as many
    calls to the metadata service than we needed, once using
    the custom opener we create, and once using urllib2.urlopen.
    
    I've also added a unit test for this fix.  It's admittedly a bit
    contrived, but it did fail before implementing the fix, and it
    does pass now with the fix in place.

1	2	boto/utils.py
32	0	tests/unit/utils/test_utils.py

commit dbeffdc096b218b9e63754e04edff18ee70e3aae
Merge: f24a166f 6d33ba88
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2013-04-11 16:03:39 -0700

    Merge branch 'metadata-num-retries' into develop
    
    Closes #1436.
    
    * metadata-num-retries:
      Add metadata_service_num_attempts config option

commit 6d33ba8846903065de2fea31ddc2870d8120d41a
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2013-04-11 12:25:19 -0700

    Add metadata_service_num_attempts config option
    
    When retrieving credentials from the metadata service,
    it is possible to set a config option to specify the number
    of seconds before timing out the request, but no option
    exists that specifies the number of attempts to make to
    the metadata service.
    
    I also made two changes to the metadata retrieval process:
    
    * If we're on the last iteration of our retry loop we
    don't sleep.  This allows us to maintain our 1 second max delay
    by default if no metadata credentials are available.
    
    * Remove urllib2 error catching. This is raised when a timeout
    occurs and this is something we definitely want to retry.
    
    Added a unittest for the config option and also verified
    on an EC2 instance with an IAM role specified that the failure
    conditions are retried appropriately when
    metadata_service_num_attempts is set.

5	1	boto/provider.py
3	3	boto/utils.py
17	1	docs/source/boto_config_tut.rst
28	0	tests/unit/provider/test_provider.py

commit 8f466ebcac5fa22743bae37ef3d3312c79348a9b
Author: Jeff Terrace <jterrace@google.com>
Date:   2013-04-04 13:40:10 -0700

    Change GS calls to make_request to always convert to utf-8 bytes.
    
    Previously, if the body string was encoded as bytes but a parameter (e.g. key
    name) was a unicode string, the underlying httplib/socket layer would get
    unicode decode errors when the mixing would force a unicode cast.

10	10	boto/gs/bucket.py
4	2	boto/gs/connection.py
6	7	boto/gs/key.py

commit c44cb37280dae2aca1e182c6b4bf45304329d5c2
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2013-04-04 14:48:26 -0700

    Allow kwargs to be passed through to uplaoder
    
    Rather than keep concurrent_create_archive_from_file
    and ConcurrentUploader in sync with their argument,
    **kwargs is now forwarded to ConcurrentUploader so that
    whatever args ConcurrentUploader may grow,
    concurrent_create_archive_from_file will support those args.

    Added sleeps to allow amazon time to propogate
    
    The policy statements would some times not be propogated by the time we
    went looking for them.  While I hate inserting time into the tests, this
    seems to be the safest way.  I believe 3 seconds should be enough (1 was
    enough in all my tests).

commit dd8130ac3010c2ecedabd1e16937f814d0161c02

commit 777b81262265a324988a4a1c4c4bcf832e6c6c0a
Author: Michael Barrett <loki77@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-03-28 14:45:55 -0700

    Clean up some unnessary if statements

5	5	boto/sns/connection.py

commit 9b09f6cf8cacb236b8b7e2e98e8094f66f4c9cc2
Author: Michael Barrett <loki77@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-03-28 14:31:36 -0700

    Make subscribe_sqs_queue idempotent
    
    This patch changes the sid from being a random UUID4 string to an md5
    hash of the combined topic & queue ARN.  Since the Sid is now a known
    value we can check to see if a Statement with the given Sid already
    exists.  If it does, do not add it again.
    
    The reason for this is that as subscribe_sqs_queue is it isn't
    idempotent.  It will add the same statement (with a new Sid) repeatedly
    until you hit the limits of the SQS Policy (20 statements, 8192 bytes).

15	7	boto/sns/connection.py

commit eef0e8808f12c1854a0452e4f73df05fd65e6854

Author: Max Noel <mnoel@ludia.com>

commit 865ee43d2e97db3edc31c2b5fbd9cb69c7c281c2
Author: Nate <nate@knewton.com>
Date:   2013-02-26 11:11:29 -0500

    CRITICAL FIX
    
        The teardown method used to delete ALL LOAD BALANCERS in your account.
        Though this is not necessarily a bad thing on its own, it can really
        burn you if you happen to run the integration tests in a staging
        environment that you care about.
    
        The fix makes all assertions that are based on modifications to load
        balancers refer to the fixture that is created in the setup method.
        There was repeated code that was doing the same thing as the setup
        method--this code also cleans this up.
    
        NOTE: THIS IS JUST A FIX TO elb/test_connection.py. All of the
        integration tests need to be looked at with this issue in mind.

47	55	tests/integration/ec2/elb/test_connection.py

commit 08e06b06d77e36cfe4e985f05cd3c6dda5c0a60f
Author: ksacry <ksacry@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-02-14 22:10:52 -0700

    fix file descriptor leak
    
    The file to be uploaded is opened, but not closed once the upload is completed.
    If you upload multiple files with the same ConcurrentUploader all files remain open and you eventually run out of file descriptors
    This adds a _cleanup function that gets called when work is done that closes the file

8	0	boto/glacier/concurrent.py

commit 69dd21d71f130a1b7d98be75081ddb9cb432fea7

Merge: 94ad96d5 468c7530

commit 468c7530bf0d63b489fa9b17b2962f2a25f36ec1
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2013-01-23 11:29:52 -0800

    Use Vault.DefaultPartSize is possible
    
    As mentioned in #1264, self.DefaultPartSize is not
    considered when calculating the minimum part size.
    This is an issue whenever
    vault.DefaultPartSize != utils.DEFAULT_PART_SIZE.
    
    Also added a unit test to verify that DefaultPartSize is
    obeyed (provided that it can accomodate the file size).

22	3	boto/glacier/utils.py
2	3	boto/glacier/vault.py
5	0	tests/unit/glacier/test_utils.py
43	11	tests/unit/glacier/test_vault.py

commit 03fe12612fad12e0bca47dade91434ce0566dbdb
Author: Gaige B Paulsen <github@gbp.gaige.net>
Date:   2013-01-23 05:43:26 -0500

    Restore use of DefaultPartSize for uploads
    
    Restore use of DefaultPartSize for uploads where a file is provided.
    Problem was introduced when the auto-calculation was done, which was
    fine for upping the size if it was too small, but it had the side-effect
    of decreasing it needlessly (and thus creating more transaction cost).

3	1	boto/glacier/vault.py

commit f1eee4c44c763bb0713f0bc18bf7697eb494defa
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2013-01-18 11:20:25 -0800

    Add support for website bucket redirect rules
    
    This is a backwards compatible change that updates the
    ``configure_website`` method on the ``Bucket`` class with
    extra parameters.
    
    I've extracted the website configuration into it's own class,
    similar to the CORS and Lifecycle configurations, but only
    used it internally for the implementation of configure_website.
    We could also add a method on Bucket that takes a WebsiteConfiguration
    object directly, but I've not added that.
    
    This is a direct mapping to the API as specified in:
    http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/RESTBucketPUTwebsite.html
    
    I've added unittests and integration tests for these changes,
    and the existing integration test for website configuration still
    passes.

21	7	boto/s3/bucket.py
237	0	boto/s3/website.py
21	0	tests/integration/s3/test_bucket.py
160	0	tests/unit/s3/test_website.py

commit f4453edaaccfbd40c527caa2a3df2a1540a4ce6f
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2013-01-14 15:29:04 -0800

    Add helper function to serialize list of structures
    
    For query services that have operations that accept a list
    of complex types, this helper function provides a simple
    way to serialize those params.  There are several services
    that can be refactored to use this new method, but I think
    it makes sense to do that on a case by case basis (and as
    separate commits).
    
    I added unit tests for this as well, but given that these
    were for the AWSQueryConnection class, I put the test file
    in the top level tests/unit directory.

commit 30485a3d067ef16d42fd84d84d4a809764567df6
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2013-01-03 17:04:06 -0800

    Account for empty archives in hash calculations
    
    This will send back a response from glacier stating
    that we can't have a content-length of 0.
    
    I think this makes the most sense, especially if empty
    archives ever are allowed, then we don't have to change
    anything on our end.

commit 109a933eea67ded52672acf44a07d2dfac91b389
Author: Martin Davidsson <martin@dropcam.com>
Date:   2013-01-02 13:22:24 -0800

    Correct layer1 scan documentation for limit param
    
    "Limit - The maximum number of items to evaluate (not necessarily the
    number of matching items). If Amazon DynamoDB processes the number of
    items up to the limit while processing the results, it stops and returns
    the matching values up to that point, and a LastEvaluatedKey to apply in
    a subsequent operation to continue retrieving items. Also, if the
    scanned data set size exceeds 1MB before Amazon DynamoDB reaches this
    limit, it stops the scan and returns the matching values up to the
    limit, and a LastEvaluatedKey to apply in a subsequent operation to
    continue the scan."
    
    http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/amazondynamodb/latest/developerguide/API_Scan.html

1	1	boto/dynamodb/layer1.py

commit 9ac99a156e8e62a81867139e32ef0ff8eb5dbae7
Author: Munehisa Kamata <mk1218@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-01-02 11:24:28 +0900

    Convert an SQS queue policy to a correct format before modifying it
    
    queue.get_attributes('Policy') in subscribe_sqs_queue method returns
    a dictionary object which only has 'Policy' as a key. This is not an
    expected format in subscribe_sqs_queue and will cause 400 "Bad request"
    if specified queue has any policy. So converting the dictionary object
    to a correct format before modifying it will avoid it.

2	1	boto/sns/connection.py

commit c8b848c1e9d75dd88ea44d9adc3850814034d818
Author: Sean Myers <sean.dst@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-01-01 18:17:50 -0500

    Unconditional 'else' was causing breakage
    
    While writing unit tests to make sure _sign_string works in all possible cases
    I discovered that my unconditional 'else' clause was making it so that
    private_key_string would never be used. That has been addressed.

1	1	boto/cloudfront/distribution.py

commit 5a3e8f1e4448829f497bf9d9e19d14144ac17dbf
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2012-12-13 11:25:12 -0800

    Add a table_from_schema method to DynamoDB Layer2
    
    This makes it easier to create a Table object if you
    already know the schema of your table.  Normally,
    get_table is used, which calls describe_table to retrieve
    the schema.  If you'd like to avoid this call you
    can use table_from_schema (provided you know your schema).
    
    Part of this change included an easy way to create Schema
    objects directly using the Schema class.  The Layer2.create_schema
    method was then refactored to use the Schema.create classmethod.
    
    I've included unittests for all the changes as well as
    an integration test that verifies that constructing Table
    objects in various ways all create equal Table objects.

commit 6767cec8f9da48de946e6d079e8ef69bc923966c
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2012-12-12 13:15:35 -0800

    Add toggle to use Decimals with DynamoDB Layer2
    
    The gist of this change is to refactor the
    serialization/deserialization of python types to the format
    that the dynamodb expects into a single "Dynamizer" interface.
    
    This interface is then plumbed into Layer2 and can be passed in
    via the __init__.  This also allows users to entirely override
    this process if they need.
    
    I implemented two types of Dynamizers:
    
    * Dynamizer - Uses Decimals to handle numeric types.
    * LossyFloatDynamizer - Uses int/float to handle numeric types.
    
    I made the default dynamizer the LossyFloatDynamizer which will
    maintain backwards compatibility (all of the dynamodb tests pass).
    
    If a user wants to use decimals, they can either pass in the
    appropriate dynamizer:
    
      dynamodb = boto.connect_dynamodb(dynamizer=Dynamizer)
    
    or use the `use_decimals` convenience method::
    
      dynamodb = boto.connect_dynamodb()
      dynamodb.use_decimals()
    
    If a user wants to customize this process, they can subclass
    Dynamizer and either override `encode` or `decode`, or they
    can override a specific conversion.  For example:
    
      class UnicodeDynamizer(Dynamizer):
        def decode_s(self, attr):
            return unicode(attr)
    
      dynamodb = boto.connect_dynamodb(dynamizer=UnicodeDynamizer)
    
    I've added unittests/integration tests for the new functionality.

23	19	boto/dynamodb/layer2.py
94	13	boto/dynamodb/types.py
32	1	tests/integration/dynamodb/test_layer2.py
82	0	tests/unit/dynamodb/test_types.py

commit b3e8f041a834198c3851324f3e0a650060c4d8f2
Author: Thomas O'Dowd <tpodowd@cloudian.com>
Date:   2012-12-12 18:53:58 +0900

    Support Expiration date in bucket lifecycle object.
    
    Changed the expiration parameter to be similar to the transition
    parameter. It is now an object. The methods still take an
    integer number of days but any code that looks directly at
    the value of rule.expiration and expects it to be an integer
    will now fail :-( Not sure how to make the transition smoother.
    
    Added a unit test to test multiple rules together.

67	20	boto/s3/lifecycle.py
54	18	tests/integration/s3/test_bucket.py

commit 5877506c36ef4817bec147b597e0b584f69fc003

commit 3274d416c987d98697a4cb2aa3e693c8b60cb132
Merge: 2604f748 a7758064
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2012-12-05 14:09:15 -0800

    Merge branch 'mraposa-concurrent_downloader' into develop

commit a7758064b5f52f5b41b9509cde86523ed1aeb501
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2012-11-27 14:15:58 -0800

    Integrate glacier downloads into concurrent module
    
    There a few minor improvements made when integrating the
    concurrent_download module into the concurrent module:
    
    * There is now a ConcurrentUploader and a ConcurrentDownloader
      class in the concurrent module.
    * I refactored part of the ConcurrentDownloader so that it could
      share common code with the uploader.  This code was pulled into
      a ConcurrentTransferer base class.  This can likely be improved.
    * The tree hashes for the individual parts (as well as the final
      archive) are verified.
    * Avoid the use of tempfiles for the individual downloaded parts.
      Instead the master thread will pull the actual downloaded content
      off of the result queue and seek to the appropriate location in
      the destination file before writing the contents.  This saves on
      both disk space and performance (the file is written to as soon
      as content is available).
    
    I also added some basic unittests to check the concurrent uploader
    downloader.  They're very basic for now, and I'd like to eventually
    improve them to be more exhaustive.

227	47	boto/glacier/concurrent.py
0	231	boto/glacier/concurrent_download.py
7	3	boto/glacier/exceptions.py
120	0	tests/unit/glacier/test_concurrent.py

commit 02d9d2b87e4a315eef21b1eeff0c4fcb1e211fa6
Author: Dennis McRitchie <dmcr@Princeton.EDU>
Date:   2012-11-27 15:16:39 -0500

    1) Changed the Common Request Parameter used to specify the requested operation from
    'Action' to 'Operation' to conform to the spec.
    2) Modified build_list_params to support both an array of parameter names, or
    a string containing a set of whitespace- or comma-delimited parameter names.

commit f725244241d871b04e5c35a5cfdf4b25a6a0eef3
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2012-11-21 13:52:07 -0800

    Switch SQS to signature version 4
    
    There were a few structural changes needed to support this
    change.
    
    To keep compatilibity with python < 2.7.3, we use the
    queue.amazonaws.com endpoint because < 2.7.3 we can't
    validate the subjectAltName of the SSL certs.
    
    However, for sigv4, the service name needs to be 'sqs' and not
    'queue'.  Ideally, the service name and region name are derived
    from the endpoint, but we can't use the sqs.us-east-1.amazonaws.com
    because this is the subjectAltName of the SSL cert.
    
    This fix offers two mechanisms:
    
    * The auth_service_name/auth_region_name properties on the connection
      class, which allows you to set these values:
    
        sqs = connect_sqs()
        sqs.auth_service_name = 'sqs'
        sqs.auth_region_name = 'us-east-1'
    
    * An 'AuthServiceName' class attribute that will be used to set the
      auth_service_name value when the connection class is initialized.
    
    This allows us to use 'sqs' for the credential scope required for
    signature version 4, and allows us to use the queue.*.com endpoints
    to ensure proper SSL cert validation for older pythons.
    
    Also, the auth_region_name is automatically set to
    self.region.name when the SQS client is initialized.  This allows
    SQS to work properly with sigv4 in non us-east-1 regions.
    
    Unittests pass, SQS integration tests pass.

19	0	boto/connection.py
3	1	boto/sqs/connection.py
4	1	tests/unit/__init__.py
0	0	tests/unit/sqs/__init__.py
90	0	tests/unit/sqs/test_connection.py

commit da6d38180402d9b340d2a27781581de2717d74a4
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2012-11-21 13:26:02 -0800

    Allow service_name/region_name to be overriden
    
    For Signature version 4, you can now explicitly set
    the region_name/service_name that's used for generating
    the signature.  If these attributes are set, then the
    endpoint url is not used for determining the appropriate
    credential scope.

24	5	boto/auth.py
10	0	tests/unit/auth/test_sigv4.py

    Sort by param keys only for sigv4
    
    The sigv4 spec states that the canonical_query_string
    should be sorted by the param keys only.  Boto was
    previously using 'key=value' as the sort key.

commit afb22cc3f233de37b668356c8386530d307239c6
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2012-11-08 14:15:00 -0800

    Add part size check to concurrent uploads
    
    This integrates the logic from #1099 into the concurrent multipart
    uploader.  The part_size parameter passed into the __init__ is obeyed
    unless it is below the minimum required part size.  If this happens the
    minimum required part size will automatically be used (and a message
    regarding this is logged).

commit fe2359f7b179b1cdfb6c475625548b153a5c53cf
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2012-10-23 17:08:08 -0700

    Add long polling support to SQS
    
    This change adds the wait_time_seconds param to the sqs module.
    When receiving a message on an SQS queue, you can now
    specify how long to block before returning without any
    messages.  This also required a bump of the API version
    to 2012-11-05.
    
    I've added some integration tests that demonstrate this feature.

commit 0c7cb91be9c842d2bccfc9e28642175ca4157453
Author: Robie Basak <robie@justgohome.co.uk>
Date:   2012-10-14 23:18:49 +0100

    Work around Amazon ListParts RangeInBytes bug
    
    Amazon's ListParts implementation returns off-by-ones in parts'
    RangeInBytes fields, contrary to their documentation.
    
    Reported here:
    https://forums.aws.amazon.com/thread.jspa?threadID=106866&tstart=0
    
    For now, a workaround is to fix the result up by hand in the common case
    of a full (non-last) part, since we know that this particular off-by-one
    is impossible. If we end up with the wrong RangeInBytes in this
    particular case, then the worst that will happen is that the upload
    resume functionality will mismatch on the hash and re-upload the part.

7	0	boto/glacier/vault.py
9	1	tests/unit/glacier/test_layer2.py

commit 0fea70bc3cc11756f2db89de29e81643550771f8
Author: Ken Hagler <khagler@orange-road.com>
Date:   2012-11-04 10:43:46 -0800

    Fix multipart uploads too big for default part size
    
    The default part size of 4 MB is too small for any files over 40,000 MB, and there's no checking to ensure that a part size passed in is big enough.
    
    I added a check to make sure the default part size is big enough. If it's not, the minimum part size needed is found and then it figures what what the smallest part size allowed by Amazon's API is and uses that instead.

commit 8dbf6391ec71a92d529bbf0a950613350b564db5
Author: g2harris <greg.2.harris@nokia.com>
Date:   2012-11-02 11:13:38 -0300

    Fix HTTP timeouts for SSL connections
    
    CertValidatingHTTPSConnection did not implement the http.HTTPConnection timeout argument correctly.  Newer Botos appear to use this connection instead of httplib.HTTPSConnection which breaks the [Boto]/http_connection_timeout configuration setting.
    
    This patch sets the timeout on the new SSL socket if it has been configured.

commit 9c82c9d7d13c317ecd52c4f0cf5c10425fea7a90
Merge: b1d191f9 9a50a7ed
Author: Chris Moyer <kopertop@gmail.com>

commit 4fb722fe5780f97d7b97d45e36c382e79eca315c
Author: Greg Harris <greg.2.harris@nokia.com>
Date:   2012-10-24 16:10:59 -0400

    Fix HmacAuthV4Handler to treat POST parameters properly.
    
    I ran into this problem when digging into why AWS was returning HTTP 505 Version Not Supported
    responses for autoscaling's CreateLaunchConfiguration action.  In past cases it looks like this
    error has occurred when the query string of GET requests exceed some threshold (AWS likely reads a
    fixed size and takes the last 5 bytes on the first line as the HTTP version).  Although the
    AWSQueryConnection.get_object call was set to use POST the actual request consisted of a POST with
    all of the parameters in the query string.
    
    In researching this I figured out the logic to actually map request parameters into the query string
    (GET requests) or into the request body (POST requests) actually occurs in the add_auth call in
    _mexe shortly before the request is issued to Amazon.  For HmacAuthV4Handler there was no special
    POST request handling so parameters always came in as query strings with the method 'POST'.
    
    This patch does the following:
    
        (1) Moves the query string / request body manipulation on HmacAuthV4Handler to before the
    canonical_request is calculated so that the request body signature is correctly generated.
    
        (2) Updates the canonical_uri to look at req.auth_path instead of req.path.  Since the query
    string manipulation is occuring before the request is signed now we need to use the cached version
    of this field that is set aside for authentication already.
    
        (3) Modify canonical_query_string to return '' when a POST request is used.  This is because the
    parameters in a POST request will now be part of the body when calculating the canonical_request to
    sign.
    
    This appears to do the right thing in the cases I've tested.  It does blow away the contents of
    request.body when their is a query string present so if anything ever attempts to make a POST call
    with both params and data set bad things could happen.  This is just copying the behaviour already
    present in QuerySignatureHelper when a POST request is processed.

18	6	boto/auth.py

commit 70413d0a524c6df46b72b676a4c7cd59ce8d95f5

commit b6d9db608d8215d3fddf7131dd6e1a3b2c03b42d
Author: g2harris <greg.2.harris@nokia.com>
Date:   2012-10-23 19:06:25 -0300

    Update boto/auth.py
    
    When using a proxy server AWSAuthConnection.build_base_http_request will modify the http_request.path to include the host header.  It caches the original path in the auth_path field so that the signature can be later correctly generated.
    
    Both the HMACAuthV3HTTPHandler and HMACAuthV4HTTPHandler signature generation methods in auth.py look at the original path and not auth_path which means boto will generate an incorrect signature when using a proxy server.
    
    This patch updates those signature generation methods to use auth_path instead of path.

2	2	boto/auth.py

commit e385a8c0272eb3ef5064e3849798036ee36899e5

commit 6531a5f08700239b23e2ab78e240801440dca513

      copy_part_from_key() method and passed through to copy_key()
    - Header support is required to set headers such as:
      * x-amz-copy-source-if-match
      * x-amz-copy-source-if-none-match
      * x-amz-copy-source-if-unmodified-since
      * x-amz-copy-source-if-modified-since

commit b2b52fc9f2cdcf0b23cdb910dea607abb1273bf4
Author: Rafael Cunha de Almeida <rafael@zunnit.com>
Date:   2012-10-09 18:11:04 -0300

    Convert binary value back to Binary type
    
    After retrieving an item which has a binary field, it would fail to be
    saved unless all binary fields were mapped back to Binary. This commit
    solves that problem by automatically mapping binary fields to Binary
    when an item is retrieved from dynamoDB.

commit eef606ddb7df94be988ad7981e9f1e8eb91ec325
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2012-09-28 09:25:47 -0700

    Condense multiple whitespace into a single space
    
    For sigv4, when computing the cononical headers, any inner
    whitespace should be condensed to a single whitespace:
    
    'x-amz-foo: foo  bar  baz'
    'x-amx-foo: foo bar baz'
    
    Otherwise the signature will be incorrect.

3	3	boto/auth.py
0	0	tests/unit/auth/__init__.py
51	0	tests/unit/auth/test_sigv4.py

commit 610752daaf00b3ae69f4b2c8ced216798291389e
Author: Hong Minhee <minhee@dahlia.kr>
Date:   2012-09-25 11:47:14 +0900

    Close opened file
    
    While file.__del__ closes itself in CPython, PyPy doesn't use
    reference counting but garbage collection, so destructors aren't
    automatically closed immediately.  Invoked time of __del__ is
    indeterministic in PyPy.
    
    Theoretically it must never cause any problem, but in real world
    we can't assume setup.py script is immediately terminated.
    Because in many cases users install boto using setuptools/easy_install.
    It might cause "too many open files" error.  In Windows opened files
    aren't accessible by other process.
    
    So we should explicitly call file.close() in try-finally block or
    use with block.  This patch uses the latter way.

7	1	setup.py

commit 5672c19b69694d9407a4ec68fc833074fb704380
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2012-09-19 12:20:22 -0700

    Use the params arg to AWSAuthConnection.make_request
    
    Adding the params to the uri arg will cause the sigv4
    signer to create the wrong canonical string.  By explicitly
    passing the params as a separate arg, the sigv4 signer can
    do the right thing.
    
    Previously this would cause signature errors.

1	6	boto/glacier/layer1.py

commit adb238e5d2a2a2f5bade8a84ef2fc706d790061f
Author: James Saryerwinnie <js@jamesls.com>
Date:   2012-09-19 12:19:18 -0700

    Add params arg to AWSAuthConnection.make_request
    
    This arg is then forwarded to build_base_http_request,
    which previously was always passing an empty params dict.

5	2	boto/connection.py
